msContents.summary: Scripture by various authors known as New Testament [n]

objectDesc.p: Parchment, 26x21, 31 extant leaf(s), 2 column(s), 27-31 line(s) per column, 8-13 characters per line, written in Greek/Coptic.

handDesc.handNote: 300-499 Original scribe with professional hand (252 verses).

additions.p: Coptic verses are written on the recto.

history.provenance: [1-2,5,6a,15] Obtained by Bibliothèque nationale de France (National Library of France) at Paris, France.
[3-4] Obtained by Morgan Library and Museum at New York, NY.
[6b,16-17] Obtained by Bibliothèque nationale de France (National Library of France) at Paris, France.
[7-14,19-31] Discovered at Dayr Anbā Shanūdah, Miṣr.
[7-14,19-31] Purchased by Angelus Antonius Bergomas at Naqādah, Miṣr.
[7-14,19-31] Donated 1778 to Cardinal Stefano Borgia at Velletri, Italia.
[7-14,19-31] Transferred 1805 to Sacra Congregatio de Propoganda Fide Library, Museo Borgiano (Sacred Congregation for the Propagation of the Faith, Borgia Museum) at Roma, Italia.
[7-14,19-31] Transferred 1919 to Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana (Vatican Apostolic Library) at Città del Vaticano.
[18] Obtained by Bibliothèque nationale de France (National Library of France) at Paris, France.

msIdentifier.msName: [1-2,5,6a,15] Copte 129-7 fol. 35, 129-8 fol. 121, 122, 140, 157, Bibliothèque nationale de France (National Library of France), Paris, France.
[3-4] M. 664A, Morgan Library and Museum, New York, NY.
[6b,16-17] Copte 129-9 fol. 49, 65, 129-10 fol. 209, Bibliothèque nationale de France (National Library of France), Paris, France.
[7-14,19-31] Borgia Coptic 109, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana (Vatican Apostolic Library), Città del Vaticano.
[18] Copte 129-9 fol. 76, Bibliothèque nationale de France (National Library of France), Paris, France.

sourceDesc.bibl: [1-2,5-6,15-18] Amelineau, M.E., Notice des Manuscrits Coptes de la Bibliotheque Nationale, Imprimerie Nationale: Paris, France, 1895. OCLC 9640930.

[3-4] Willker, Wieland, “Noteworthy fragmentary parchment manuscripts noted in this commentary”, An Online Textual Commentary on the Greek Gospels, 10th ed., http://www-user.uni-bremen.de/wie/TCG/Fragmentary-Uncials.pdf: Bremen, Deutschland, 2012.
[7-14,19-31] Balestri, P. J., Sacrorum Bibliorum Fragmenta Copto-Sahidica Musei Borgiani, Congregatio de Propagande Fide: Romae, Italia, 1904. OCLC 7365254.
